Plasmid Construction for Cell Line Development

The vector construction step of monoclonal antibody (mAb) cell line development requires identifying a gene sequence and assembling it for packaging into a recombinant plasmid. Golden Gate and Gibson assembly are methods of generating recombinant plasmids by ligating small oligos together. Our Danaher Life Sciences companies can support your recombinant plasmid construction with synthetic oligos from IDT and aBeckman Coulter Echo Acoustic Liquid Handler to acoustically array combinations of oligos and reagents for rapid plasmid creation. Use a Molecular Devices QPix 400-Series Microbial Colony Picker to automate the picking and streaking of bacterial cultures producing the desired plasmid. Prepare samples and distribute screening reagents with aBeckman Coulter Life Sciences Biomek i-Series Automated Workstation.

Data capture and proper handling are chief concerns during a drug development workflow. Across workflow steps, the IDBS Polar Biopharma Lifecycle Management platform can tie instruments and workflow processes together with data acquisition and management. Workflow solutions and instrument integrations for end-to-end biopharma lifecycle management make data handling and audit reporting easier.
